definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll

sentences.english: The cheerful little girl with bouncy golden curls was almost five.
sentences.chinese: 头顶摇幌著金色发卷的，快乐小女孩，快要满五岁了。

sentences.english: Please set it for a formal occasion.
sentences.chinese: 请上发卷作适合正式场合的发型。

sentences.english: Do you love a laddie with curly brown hair?
sentences.chinese: 你可爱着一位棕发卷卷的小伙儿？

sentences.english: Five minutes before the time is the hair volume, the examinee fill out the ticket.
sentences.chinese: 考前五分钟是发卷时间，考生填写准考证。

sentences.english: We put one or two curl rags in her hair and secured them with combs.
sentences.chinese: 我们还在她的头发上做了一两个用梳子扎好的布发卷。

sentences.english: That curler is pulling my hair too tight.
sentences.chinese: 这个发卷把我的头发拉得太紧了。

sentences.english: Light little curls clustered round her forehead.
sentences.chinese: 她额前留有几簇小发卷。
